questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "This fish is smaller than that fish."
questions.explanation: Smaller is a comparative adjective showing that this fish is less big than the other fish.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "He is the ______ in the class."
questions.explanation: Tallest is a superlative adjective that shows he is the most tall in the entire class.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "Today is hotter than yesterday."
questions.explanation: Hotter is a comparative adjective that indicates today has more heat than yesterday.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "The blue dress is prettier than the red dress."
questions.explanation: Prettier is a comparative adjective showing that the blue dress has more beauty than the red dress.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "That was the ______ race I have ever run."
questions.explanation: Fastest is a superlative adjective that indicates this race was the fastest of all.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "My sister is younger than I am."
questions.explanation: Younger is a comparative adjective that shows my sister is less old than I am.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "This is the ______ dog I have ever seen!"
questions.explanation: Cutest is a superlative adjective that means this dog is the most cute of all.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "The red apple is sweeter than the green apple."
questions.explanation: Sweeter is a comparative adjective showing that the red apple has more sweetness than the green apple.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "He is the ______ player on the team."
questions.explanation: Best is a superlative adjective showing he is the most good player on the team.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "She is ______ than her brother."
questions.explanation: Smarter is a comparative adjective that shows she is more smart than her brother.

questions.question: Which of the following is a superlative adjective?
questions.explanation: Tallest is a superlative adjective because it indicates that one thing is the tallest compared to all others in a group.

questions.question: Which of the following is a comparative adjective?
questions.explanation: Better is a comparative adjective because it compares two things, showing that one is more good than the other.

questions.question: Which of the following is a superlative adjective?
questions.explanation: Coldest is a superlative adjective because it indicates that something has the most coldness compared to all others in a group.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "The giraffe is taller than the zebra."
questions.explanation: Taller is a comparative adjective because it compares the height of two animals, showing the giraffe is taller than the zebra.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "The chocolate cake is sweeter than the vanilla cake."
questions.explanation: Sweeter is a comparative adjective because it compares the taste of two cakes, showing one is more sweet than the other.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "This book is longer than the other one."
questions.explanation: Longer is a comparative adjective because it compares the length of two books, showing one is longer than the other.

questions.question: Find the adjective that compares: "Her backpack is heavier than mine."
questions.explanation: Heavier is a comparative adjective because it compares the weight of two backpacks, showing one is more heavy than the other.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "My house is ______ than yours."
questions.explanation: Taller is a comparative adjective that shows my house is taller compared to your house.

questions.question: Which of the following is a superlative adjective?
questions.explanation: Biggest is a superlative adjective that means something is the most big compared to everything else.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "This test was ______ than the last one."
questions.explanation: Harder is a comparative adjective that shows the current test was more difficult than the previous one.
